title: Lundin Mining Pre-Announces Items Impacting the Fourth Quarter 2023 Results
description: Items of significant impact in the fourth quarter 2023 are expected to include unaudited foreign exchange and trading gains on debt and equity investments supporting the capital funding for the Josemaria Project of approximately $19 million on a pre-tax basis and unaudited realized gains on foreign exchange and diesel derivative contracts of approximately $9 million on a pre-tax basis.

title: Rwanda Bill clears first Lords hurdle as Archbishop Of Canterbury issues warning
description: The Most Rev Justin Welby accused the Government of outsourcing the country’s ‘legal and moral responsibilities’.

title: Rwanda: 'We can as a nation do better', says Archbishop of Canterbury as bill passes latest Lords hurdle
description: Justin Welby says plans to deport asylum seekers to the African nation is "leading the nation down a damaging path". But peers nod the scheme through - for now.

title: Reeves refuses to use £28bn figure while defending Labour green investment plan
description: In 2021, shadow chancellor promised that a Labour government would borrow £28bn a year for five years to fund green energy projects

title: Tory Teesside Mayor’s freeport project cleared of corruption
description: The Tory Mayor of Teesside Lord Houchen has been cleared of wrongdoing at a flagship freeport project in the north following an inquiry into claims of cronyism and corruption. A review into the finances of the Teesworks project, based on a former steelworks site in Redcar, found “no evidence” to support allegations of illegality.

title: Two more arrests after teenagers stabbed to death in Bristol
description: Police have arrested two more men after two teenage boys were stabbed to death in Bristol.

title: Beleaguered Rishi Sunak on a wing and a prayer – and now a fasting regime

title: Investigation into bad practice by agents recruiting overseas students launched
description: Universities minister Robert Halfon said he was ‘appalled’ by reports about the way international students are recruited at some universities.

title: Labour pledges to slash payouts for outgoing ministers after £1m government bill
description: Labour has pledged to slash the size of severance payouts for ministers leaving office after it emerged nearly £1m was spent in a year due to political churn. Ministers under the age of 65 are entitled to payments amounting to a quarter of their ...

title: Jamie Dornan breaks down in tears as he speaks about marriage to wife Amelia Warner
description: The Tourist actor Jamie Dornan, who spoke on BBC Radio 4 show Desert Island Discs yesterday, has been married to his wife Amelia Warner since 2013.

title: Nottingham victims’ families say Rishi Sunak has not ruled out public inquiry

title: World now as dangerous as in the Cold War, UK government believes
description: The world is now more dangerous than any time since the Cold War, Lord Cameron is expected to warn as he pushes for the UK to strengthen its defences against hostile actors. The Foreign Secretary is planning to make his first major speech since rejoining the Government in the coming weeks, i understands.
